This afternoon we marked the swearing in of @KSDofA, Secretary of the Kansas Department of Administration and Chief Information Technology Officer. Secretary Burns-Wallace’s long history of professionalism and accomplishments made her an ideal choice for these critical positions.
In this week's Kansan to Kansan, we recognize #BlackHistoryMonth by reflecting on the many, far-reaching accomplishments and contributions of black Kansans.

KS school bus drivers take their jobs very seriously. Transporting children - our most precious cargo - is a big responsibility. That's why I stood alongside school bus drivers today to advocate for a bill allowing them to qualify for unemployment benefits during summer months.

Congratulations to Specialist Jonathon P. Gallegos, this year's Kansas Army National Guard Best Warrior Soldier; SGT Luke Fursman, Best Warrior NCO; & Airman first Class Lilliana Rebollar, National Guard Airman of the Year. You epitomize all that's outstanding in KS armed forces.

One hundred years ago today, the League of Women Voters was founded by leaders of the women's suffrage movement. I am truly inspired by the determination, strength and courage of those who fought for women to have a voice. Let's honor that legacy by making our voices heard.

Langston Hughes, famous black poet and author, spent most of his childhood in Lawrence, Topeka and Kansas City. Hughes dedicated his life to advocating for social equality and justice through his poetry, plays, short stories and novels. #BlackHistoryMonth

I am impressed by the continued, all-hands-on-deck state and local response effort to help those affected by recent layoffs in Kansas' aviation sector. This afternoon I received a progress update from @KansasDOL Secretary Delia Garcia, @BWhippleKS & other response team members.

This morning I toured Wichita's Workforce Center before stopping by @REAPofSCK. Thank you to all of the Kansas job seekers and business owners who shared their triumphs and concerns. Maintaining a strong workforce is crucial to fostering growth and prosperity in Kansas.

The innovative partnership between @LawrenceChamber and @UnivOfKansas is instrumental in promoting economic prosperity in and around Lawrence. Thank you for inviting @SecretaryToland and me to talk about our strategies for fueling economic success in the region and across KS.

In this week's Kansan to Kansan, I discuss the details of FORWARD, our proposed statewide transportation plan. Through FORWARD, we will deliver on projects and services good for Kansas now and into the future.

Today I joined @KDOTHQ Secretary Julie Lorenz to announce the details of FORWARD, our proposed statewide transportation plan. Under FORWARD, major projects will be selected every two years rather than once a decade - and all existing T-WORKS projects will be completed. #ksleg

In July 1958, a group of black students began filling the seats at Wichita's Dockum Drug Store each day in peaceful protest of the restaurant's segregation. After about a month the owner relented, and the students' victory sparked similar protests in OK & NC. #BlackHistoryMonth

As the average age of Kansas residents continues to rise, it's critical for Kansas seniors to have access to the services they need. Thanks to @NCFHAAA for sponsoring today's Older Kansans Day event - the well-being of our state's seniors is enhanced by your advocacy.

Women have a long history of excellence when it comes to scientific contributions. But unfortunately, less than 30% of researchers worldwide are women. On #InternationalDayofWomenandGirlsinScience, let's encourage the women and girls in our lives to pursue STEM activities.

On May 17, 1954, the U.S. Supreme Court decided the landmark case known as "Brown v. Board of Education of Topeka," officially declaring segregation in schools unconstitutional. The decision laid a foundation of equal rights and opportunities for all. #BlackHistoryMonth

Kansas has lost a true trailblazer. Joe Douglas Jr., Topeka's first black fire chief, was a passionate advocate for civil rights and strong voice for minorities. He dedicated his life to helping others through community service on many fronts.

Did you know that Congenital Heart Defects are the most common birth defects in the U.S.? To promote awareness and reiterate the importance of CHD research, I signed a proclamation marking February 7 through 14 Congenital Heart Defect Awareness Week in Kansas. #CHDAwareness

During the @CSGovts Associates Breakfast in D.C. this morning, I caught up with Wisconsin's @RepBallweg and long-time friend David Adkins, former KS state senator and CEO of CSG. David's reputation as a friendly, competent leader endures in our Statehouse to this day. #ksleg

Good to sit down with @SenPatRoberts Thursday to discuss Kansas' ongoing, rapid response efforts to assist aviation sector workers impacted by recent layoffs. We also talked about funding options for a new statewide transportation plan. #ksleg

Today on #NationalWearRedDay, I'm wearing red to help @AHAKansas raise awareness of ways to end heart disease and stroke in women. Join me and #GoRedForWomen - because heart health matters to all of us.

To celebrate #BlackHistoryMonth, I asked my friends at @kansashistory to help me teach people in our state about the history & far-reaching achievements of black Kansans. I invite you to follow along on my Facebook, Twitter & Instagram accounts to learn more throughout February.

I would like to thank @KASPonline, @KSCA_tweets and the Kansas School Social Workers Association for making #SchoolMentalHealthDay at the Statehouse a success. Mental health services in schools promote healthy emotional and social development and encourage academic achievement.

Today we marked the swearing in of Secretary Jeff Zmuda of @KSCorrections and @KSHighwayPatrol Superintendent Herman Jones. They both are outstanding leaders working diligently to make Kansas a better place for all.

Your participation in the #2020Census is critical. The Census determines the flow of federal dollars into our communities, so an accurate count is essential. Please tell your friends and family about the importance of a #CompleteCount. #KansasCounts

Thank you, @GovWhitmer for the shoutout tonight in your #SOTU2020 response! Bipartisan compromise is messy and slow, but it IS possible when we try, and in the end it is the only way to make progress. #SOTU #ksleg

Throughout our history, Black Americans have played an instrumental role in shaping & strengthening our state and nation. In recognition of #BlackHistoryMonth, let us honor their achievements and recommit to the fight against racial injustice & inequality - today and every day.

Access to quality, affordable healthcare is a necessity for all Kansans – and is especially vital for those facing cancer. Today I was proud to take part in Kansas Cancer Action Day and advocate for the passage of a clean, straightforward Medicaid expansion bill.

Rosa Parks, civil rights activist, was born on this day in 1913. Her role in the Montgomery bus boycott set in motion nationwide efforts to end racial segregation on public transportation. Let her courage serve as a reminder of our duty to stand up against injustice.

While our coordinated and comprehensive rapid response approach is helping affected employees and businesses in Kansas’ aviation sector connect with needed resources after recent layoffs, there’s still much work to do. Long-term support is critical.

Today I met with local and state officials in Wichita as part of our ongoing response effort for aviation-sector workers and businesses impacted by recent layoffs. We'll continue to pursue every possible way to assist workers, Spirit and the businesses in its supply chain.
What an exciting win for the Kansas City Chiefs, now the reigning Super Bowl champions! Congratulations, #ChiefsKingdom! Enjoy this thrilling, well-deserved victory and amazing season. #SuperBowlLIV
Today's the day, #ChiefsKingdom. Sending good luck and best wishes to Miami this evening — we'll be rooting for you here in Kansas! #SuperBowlLIV
Our team is ready for Sunday. Go Chiefs! We are all rooting for you. #ChiefsKingdom

This morning I joined @KDOTHQ Secretary Julie Lorenz at the groundbreaking ceremony for the Turner Diagonal interchange. This development will make travel safer, open up economic development opportunities and modernize our infrastructure to allow us to be more competitive.

I would like to thank the Civic Council of Greater Kansas City for presenting me with the Regional Leadership Award this morning. It is truly an honor to be recognized by an organization that has done so much to make the Kansas City region a better place to live and work.

Today I had the privilege of signing a proclamation honoring Dolores Huerta, civil rights activist and labor leader, during a Latina Leaders Day Summit in the Statehouse. Huerta's fight for social justice inspired generations of leaders and changed our country for the better.

Trails and other recreational opportunities in our communities enhance local quality of life, attract businesses & grow our economy. Special thanks to @SunflowerFDN and the Kansas Trails Council for inviting me to join them at Sunflower State Trail Appreciation Day this morning.

Recently, @KDWPT launched two new mobile apps that make outdoor recreational activities in KS even more accessible. HuntFish KS allows hunters and anglers to electronically purchase and store licenses and permits; & through CampIt KS, it’s easy to reserve parks, campsites & more.

This afternoon I helped present awards for this year's Happy Birthday, Kansas! Student Photo Contest. Students statewide turned in photos with the theme "Going to School in Kansas," which resulted in hundreds of fun and interesting entries. #KansasDay

I would like to offer my sincere congratulations to all of the new American citizens who took the Oath of Allegiance this morning at the Brown v. Board of Education National Historic Site in Topeka. Your hard work and dedication is inspirational.

Today the United States-Mexico-Canada agreement was signed into law, which will encourage growth for Kansas ag. I would like to thank all who ensured this agreement's success - the enhanced export opportunities will benefit Kansas farmers, businesses and our economy as a whole.

The Governor’s Council on Tax Reform is involved in ongoing study of the current tax and budget situation in Kansas, and in its initial report made sound recommendations that would return Kansas to a balanced approach of sales, income and property taxes.

Each year on #KansasDay, we celebrate the many qualities that make Kansas great - from the state's natural beauty to its diverse communities. I encourage all Kansans to learn more about our state's rich history. We have so many reasons to be proud. Happy birthday, Kansas!

The @KansasChamber has a long and distinguished history of working to develop and promote a business-friendly climate. It was an honor to attend the Chamber's annual dinner and emphasize how we can work together for the betterment of our business community and state as a whole.

I can think of no person more deserving of this honor than Bernadette Gray-Little, former chancellor of the University of Kansas. Her vision of educating leaders, building healthy communities and making important discoveries transformed KU for the better.
Congratulations to all of the honorees at tonight’s Native Sons and Daughters of Kansas event. You’ve made Kansas a better place with your outstanding achievements.

The celebration continues with yet another birthday buddy. I would like to wish the happiest of birthdays to Lt. Jeremy Harwood, of the Kansas Highway Patrol. Thank you, Jeremy, for your hard work ensuring the safety and security of all Kansans.

Today, Judge Evelyn Wilson was officially sworn in as the newest justice of the Kansas Supreme Court. I appointed Judge Wilson because of her experience, character and deep commitment to Kansas. I am confident that she will serve our state with distinction.

Today I met Brooklyn Dodge & her mom Melissa. Brooklyn suffers from a heart condition & has had 20+ surgeries. She & I are also birthday buddies! We agree the best gift would be for #ksleg to #ExpandKanCare so her hardworking mom can access healthcare & keep their family strong.

Today we mourn the loss of Jim Lehrer, co-founder and former anchor for PBS NewsHour and a respected journalist. Lehrer, a Wichita native, dedicated his life to upholding truth and transparency in our nation through his reporting. We have lost a truly exceptional individual.

This morning I attended the grand opening of @KansasCommerce's newest Mobile Workforce Center. The center allows us to expand access to much-needed @KansasWorkforce services to both employers and job seekers across the state - when and where they are needed most. #KANSASWORKS

I would like to thank @KansasCounties and @LeagueKSMunis for inviting me to visit with them at their annual Local Government Day event. We best serve our Kansas communities when we take time to communicate with local officials and other constituents.

Agriculture is the lifeblood of our state - but there are many factors that impact our ability to maintain a strong ag sector. Today I spoke with members of our state's ag industry at their annual Legislative Action Day event to discuss what my administration can do to help.

General Weishaar is highly qualified and prepared to step up in this very important role. His depth of knowledge and years of service and training are among the reasons he's an ideal choice to serve as our next Adjutant General.

I would like to thank the Topeka Arab Shrine for this very generous show of support for members of the Kansas National Guard and their families. The donation is yet another example of the kind-hearted, selfless nature of Kansans.

Members of @kansashospitals have been committed partners and strong advocates in the ongoing push to expand Medicaid in Kansas. This morning I stopped by KHA Advocacy Day to thank them for their leadership, persistence and dedication to getting expansion across the finish line.

Wishing all Kansans a meaningful Martin Luther King Jr. Day. Whether it be by participating in a day of service or reflecting on Dr. King's philosophy, I encourage everyone to honor and celebrate his lasting legacy of non-violence, solidarity and positive change. #MLKDay
#ChiefsKingdom has waited a long time for this moment. Good luck in Super Bowl LIV! Enjoy the ride, Chiefs fans.

Tonight I was honored to celebrate Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. at @LTDTopeka’s annual scholarship and award banquet. The evening was a welcome reminder that we can make a difference when we take Dr. King’s lead and choose to stand together in mutual respect. #MLKWeekend2020

I commend the Senate for acting to approve all of my interim appointments. My administration has searched for the best candidates to hold these positions, and I’m confident they will all perform their duties with courage, poise and expertise.
Congratulations, Tabatha, on this well-deserved honor. Your hard work and dedication at the Winfield Early Learning Center help set students on a path to success. You make Kansas proud!
Due to ice, snow and cold temperatures, we are closing state government in Shawnee County on Friday. Please stay safe and warm, exercise caution and allow road crews to do their job.

Congressional passage of the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement is an important and welcome development in Kansas. USMCA will create enhanced export opportunities and help Kansans capitalize on the increased global demand for food & agriculture products.

Today I submitted my recommendation for a balanced budget that builds on progress and positions Kansas to begin a new decade of shared prosperity & growth. I look forward to input from lawmakers & working with them to enact it in a fiscally responsible way.

Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.'s important legacy of promoting nonviolence and teaching human understanding has created lasting change. Today I was proud to march alongside members of the Kansas African American Affairs Commission, @KSDofA and others to honor Dr. King. #MLKDay

My hope is that 10 years from now, when the Kansas Legislature convenes the first session of that new decade it will remember this as the Soaring '20s. A decade when we lived up to our motto, Ad Astra Per Aspera - to the stars through difficulties. #StateoftheState #ksleg
I am proud to report that Kansas has ended a turbulent decade on a high note. As we look to the future, the state of our state grows stronger every day. #StateoftheState #ksleg

Kansas' economy has shown signs of growth. We added 12,400 private sector jobs and our unemployment rate fell to its lowest point in 40 years. In fact, in CNBC's annual Top States for Business rankings, Kansas was declared the "Comeback State of 2019." #StateoftheState #ksleg

Economic downturns, failed tax policies and other factors sent Kansas into financial chaos in recent years. But since I took office, we have fully funded our schools, created jobs, reinvested in public safety and more - all with bipartisan support. #StateoftheState #ksleg

Housing shortages, affordable childcare and protecting rural hospitals are just some of the concerns rural Kansans face. The Office of Rural Prosperity, led by @LtGovRogers, will serve as an invaluable partner in sustaining our state's rural heritage. #StateoftheState #ksleg

Join us at 6:30 p.m. today, Jan. 15, as I share my vision for the blueprint of our state in 2020 through my State of the State address. #StateoftheState #ksleg

My team will continue to work to connect businesses and workers in Kansas impacted by suspension of 737 MAX production with the resources they need during this critical time. This information is an important first step as Secretary Garcia coordinates our response effort.

Today I joined @LtGovRogers as he released the Office of Rural Prosperity Listening Tour report. Lt. Governor Rogers has done great work identifying barriers to rural prosperity. We are committed to partnering with rural communities to develop policies that help Kansans succeed.

I have directed a coordinated approach across state government to help workers, Spirit and other Kansas businesses negatively impacted by planned layoffs at Spirit AeroSystems in Wichita connect with every available resource.

Yesterday I proudly stood with Senator Jim Denning to announce our compromise proposal for Medicaid expansion in Kansas - but there's still work to do. I call upon Kansas legislators to take this over the finish line and help Kansas achieve a true victory.  #ksleg

Today, on National #LawEnforcementAppreciationDay, we salute all of the men and women in our law enforcement ranks who bravely put their lives on the line every day in their communities in Kansas and beyond. Their service and dedication must never be taken for granted.

Today I announced my intention to submit an ERO creating the Kansas Department of Human Services. KDHS will help improve the safety & well-being of Kansas children & families by creating seamless access to programs families need to navigate for support.

If you have not yet received a flu vaccine this season, it's not too late. I encourage all Kansans to help fight the spread of flu and protect yourself, friends and family from its harmful - and potentially deadly - effects. #KansasFightsFlu
